medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at age 51.4 years with an episode of sudden, forceful loss of fecal contents. Multiple episodes of fecal incontinence were reported by age 52.6 years. Bladder dysfunction, initially diagnosed as benign prostatic hypertrophy, began at age 44.5 years with subsequent procedures and evaluations indicating persistent urinary retention and bladder issues. At age 55.5 years, he reported ongoing bladder dysfunction, gait instability, and intermittent fecal incontinence occurring at least once every 6 months. He noted increased fatigue and difficulty walking distances greater than a mile due to muscle weakness and tiredness after meals.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has no known liver or cardiac manifestations of Glycogen Storage Disease IV. Routine echocardiograms and electrocardiograms performed were normal.
